ssid.title: SSID
ssid.description: The name of the network with which you want to connect.

connection.title: Connection Type
connection.description: ESS is infrastructure mode, IBSS is ad-hoc.  If you have an access point or if you are unsure, use ESS.

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: How one authenticates to the network.  WPA stands for WiFi Protected Access.  PSK is Pre-Shared Key.

encryption.title: Encryption
encryption.description: WEP is insecure and you should switch to something better if possible.  Perhaps try WPA2PSK/AES.

networkkey.title: Network Key
networkkey.description: The secret passphrase or code used to join the network.

automatically.title: Key Provided Automatically
automatically.description: Is the key provided by the network automatically?

ieee802dot1x.title: IEEE 802.1x Enabled
ieee802dot1x.description: Is IEEE 802.1x access control enabled on this network?  If unsure, try not enabling this option.

autorun.title: Include Autorun
autorun.description: When enabled, adds an AUTORUN.INI file so the network settings program will be started right when you insert the jump drive into the computer.  This is usually a good thing.

batch.title: Include Batch File
batch.description: If you plan on distributing wireless settings via email, on a network drive, or wish to use them from inside a subdirectory, the setup program works much better when you run it from this batch file.  Not needed if you are just using this on the root of a USB jump drive, but also never hurts.
